articles.author: Jackie Fox
articles.title: Anxiety over threat of coronavirus in Africa
articles.description: Africa could be devastated by Covid-19 if it spreads across the continent like the way it has in Europe, according to the deputy director for Africa with the International Committee of the Red Cross.
articles.content:
Africa could be devastated by Covid-19 if it spreads across the continent like the way it has in Europe, according to the deputy director for Africa with the International Committee of the Red Cross.

articles.author: Eleanor Mannion
articles.title: Coronavirus 'drive-by' party for Sligo girl's birthday
articles.description: The friends of a 12-year-old girl held a surprise 'drive-by' party to celebrate her birthday.
articles.content:
The friends of a 12-year-old girl held a surprise 'drive-by' party to celebrate her birthday.
Katie Regan was unable to have a birthday party because of social distancing rules aimed at tackling the spread of coronavirus.
The birthday girl from Rathcormac i… [+780 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Irish man helping in NYC's fight against coronavirus
articles.description: Irish man Michael Dowling, the owner of Northwell Health, a major health company in New York, is helping in the US city's fight against Covid-19.
articles.content:
Irish man Michael Dowling, the owner of Northwell Health, a major health company in New York, is helping in the US city's fight against Covid-19.

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: US coronavirus cases surpass both China and Italy
articles.description: The United States has taken the grim title of the country with the most coronavirus infections, as the number of officially recorded cases around the world passed the grim milestone of half a million.
articles.content:
The United States has taken the grim title of the country with the most coronavirus infections, as the number of officially recorded cases around the world passed the grim milestone of half a million.

articles.author: Philip Bromwell
articles.title: New Dublin street art a response to coronavirus
articles.description: A new mural has appeared in Dublin as a response to the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.content:
A new mural has appeared in Dublin as a response to the coronavirus pandemic.
It was painted in Rathmines by artist collective SUBSET.
The group is known for works tackling a range of social issues.
The striking mural is on Richmond Hill in Rathmines
